item.title: A review of Social Physics: How Good Ideas Spread — The Lessons from a New Science, Alex Pentland
item.description: A review of Social Physics: How Good Ideas Spread — The Lessons from a New Science, Alex Pentland, 2014. Pentland and his research group have appeared to have discovered a simple model of human behavior with great predictive power. By snooping on people's cell phones, they can reduce typical human interactions into a set of interacting finite state machines, and by noticing just how regular those behavioral patterns are they think they understand ideas.
